episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the anatomy and misconceptions about face mites, the journey of a robot Mayflower ship, the legendary four-minute mile by Roger Bannister, and the censorship history of the film adaptation of 'Ulysses' in New Zealand.

facts.fact: It's a common misconception that face mites don't have an anus.
A robot version of the Mayflower has just completed a human-free voyage from England to America.
When the first four-minute miler, Roger Bannister, met his future wife Myra, she knew he was a runner but thought he'd run four miles in one minute.
When the movie Ulysses was released in New Zealand in 1967, censors were so worried about it that men and women weren't allowed to watch it at the same time.
